t: Evening Prayer of Trust in God.
For the choir director; on stringed instruments. A Psalm of David.
Answer*pn me when I call, O God of my righteousness! You*ln have relieved me in my distress; Be*ln gracious to me and hear my prayer.
O*ln sons of men, how long will my honor become a reproach? How*iln long*i will you love what is worthless and aim at deception? Selah.
But*ln know that the Lord*s has set apart the godly man for Himself; The*ln Lord*s hears when I call to Him.
Tremble,*ln and do not sin; Meditate*ln in your heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.
Offer*ln the sacrifices of righteousness, And*ln trust in the Lord.*s
Many*ln are saying, “Who will show us any*i good?” Lift*ln up the light of Your countenance upon us, O Lord!*s
You*ln have put gladness in my heart, More*ln than when their grain and new wine abound.
In*ln peace I will both lie down and sleep, For*ln You alone, O Lord,*s make me to dwell in safety.
